greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of k-ary heaps on n elements; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; local h, i, x, y, z;
if n<2 then 1 elif k<2 then k
if y<=z and z<=x then A(y, k)^(k-1-i)*
mathematica: multinomial[n_, k_] := n!/Times @@ (k!); A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = Module[{h, i, x, y, z}, Which[n<2, 1, k<2, k, True, h = Floor @ Log[k, (k-1)*n+1]; If[k^h == (k-1)*n+1, A[(n-1)/k, k]^k*multinomial[n-1, Array[((n-1)/k)&, k]], {x, y} = {(k^h-1)/(k-1), (k^(h-1)-1)/(k-1)}; For[i = 0, True, i++, z = (n-1)-(k-1-i)*y-i*x; If[y<=z && z<=x, A[y, k]^(k-1-i)*multinomial[n-1, Join[Array[y&, k-1-i], Array[x&, i], {z}]]*A[x, k]^i*A[z, k] // Return]] ]]]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 13 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal gives: A000142(n-1) for n>0.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 28 2016
